definitions: Gaspard-Félix Tournachon (1820-1910), who adopted the pseudonym Nadar, was a French photographer, aerial balloonist, and an early pioneer of photography.
A member of a caste or community in Tamil Nadu, India, traditionally involved in the cultivation of Palmyra trees and the production of toddy.
examples: Nadar was known for his portrait photography.
The Nadar community has a rich cultural heritage.
